text: Stuart Allen "Stu" Roosa (August 16, 1933 â€“ December 12, 1994), (Col., USAF), was an American aeronautical engineer, United States Air Force pilot, test pilot, and NASA astronaut. He was the Command Module Pilot for the Apollo 14 mission. He was the third mission to land astronauts (Alan Shepard and Edgar Mitchell) on the Moon. While Shepard and Mitchell spent two days on the lunar surface, Roosa made experiments from orbit in the Command Module Kitty Hawk. He was one of 24 men to travel to the Moon, which he orbited 34 times.NASA Apollo 14 page Roosa died of pancreatitis in Falls Church, Virginia on December 12, 1994 at the age of 61. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:1994 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatitis Category:Apollo astronauts Category:American aviators Category:Engineers from Colorado Category:Scientists from Colorado
title: Stuart Roosa
